intro: Adesmia ruiz-lealii, commonly known as the Mexican burro's tail, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Adesmia ruiz-lealii is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental appeal.
